title: 107_hr5404
content: The "Social Security Fairness Act of 2002" is cited as the short title. Section 202 of the Social Security Act is amended to include a new subsection regarding the termination of the last monthly insurance benefit payment upon death. The Social Security Act is amended to include a provision for the payment of an individual's benefit after their death in the first 15 days of a month. The benefit amount is reduced to 50% and rounded up to the next dollar. Payment is made according to section 204(d) for the month of death. Payment of an individual's benefit upon death will follow section 204(d) of the Social Security Act. Additionally, benefits at age 72 for certain uninsured individuals will be provided under section 228 of the Act. "Last Payment of Benefit Terminated by Death" When an individual dies within the first 15 days of a month, their monthly insurance benefit will be 50% of the original amount, rounded up to the nearest dollar. This adjustment applies after all other benefit adjustments have been made. Payment for the month of death follows standard procedures. Payment of an individual's benefit for the month of their death will follow standard procedures outlined in section 204(d) of the Social Security Act. The applicable dollar amount for any calendar year is $955, with adjustments made by the Commissioner of Social Security for subsequent years based on the national average wage index. The product is calculated by multiplying $955 by the ratio of the national average wage index for the year before the determination to the index for 2001. If the result is not a multiple of $5.00, it is rounded up to the nearest multiple of $5.00. The amendments made by this Act will apply to deaths occurring after 90 days from the enactment date.
